summary: The Whole-Home Repairs Act of 2025 establishes a pilot program to provide grants to implementing organizations (local governments, etc.) for whole-home repairs for eligible homeowners and landlords. These repairs address accessibility, habitability, energy efficiency, and safety concerns. The program includes grants for homeowners and potentially forgivable loans for landlords, with stipulations on affordable unit maintenance and rent increases. The bill outlines application processes, reporting requirements, and funding mechanisms, with a termination date of October 1, 2030.
